page.title: 05 DAIRY FARMING 1
page.content: Dairy cattle are kept for milking.The best dairy milking cow is a Friesian.These days the cows are usually milked by machines.The milk is sent to large dairies.A large milk tanker comes every morning to collect the milk from the farmiers .Cows are fed on silage and hay.They are kept in houses and put out on the grass in the begining of May.Cows have to be kept clean and dry.The milk has to pass tests for hygiene and quality.If they are testing the milk a man takes a little bottle of milk.Then he gets a long pipe and takes the milk from the milk tank into the big tank in the lorry.When the milk man is finished collecting the milk he takes it to the creamery.At the creamery it is made into butter and buttermilk.These are sent to shops.
